Method Detail

getInitializedPrimitiveTypeWrapper

public static java.lang.Object getInitializedPrimitiveTypeWrapper(java.lang.String type,
                                                                  boolean isWrapperType)
Provide a primitive type wrapper that is initialized to the primitive types initial value.

Primitive types in java in contradiction to reference types - thats' initial value is null - have an initial value. Hence, if an primitive type is encountered first and it is not explicitly initialized, it ha to be set to its initial value. As the java.lang wrapper types are used to represent primitive types in this virtual machine implementation, a new wrapper type object is constructed thats value will be the primitive type's initialization value.

This method also provides support for the symbolic invocation. If the execution mode is set to symbolic, the returned value will be a symbolic one automatically.

Parameters:
type - A String representing the type of the primitive value, e.g. "int".
isWrapperType - If set to true, a java.lang wrapper class will be expected as the type, e.g. "java.lang.String".
Returns:
An java.lang primitive wrapper object with the primitive type's initial value; or null, should the type description be unsuitable.

getInitializedPrimitiveTypeWrapper

public static java.lang.Object getInitializedPrimitiveTypeWrapper(java.lang.String type,
                                                                  boolean isWrapperType,
                                                                  boolean symbolicalType)
Provide a primitive type wrapper that is initialized to the primitive types initial value.

Primitive types in java in contradiction to reference types - thats' initial value is null - have an initial value. Hence, if an primitive type is encountered first and it is not explicitly initialized, it ha to be set to its initial value. As the java.lang wrapper types are used to represent primitive types in this virtual machine implementation, a new wrapper type object is constructed thats value will be the primitive type's initialization value.

This method offers the possibility to chose a symbolic type as the returned value.

Parameters:
type - A String representing the type of the primitive value, e.g. "int".
isWrapperType - If set to true, a java.lang wrapper class will be expected as the type, e.g. "java.lang.String".
symbolicalType - If set to true, a symbolic type will be provided.
Returns:
An java.lang primitive wrapper object with the primitive type's initial value; or null, should the type description be unsuitable.
